name: Glitter Bay

reviews.title: Glitter Bay Beach House is excellent
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 5 nights in the Venitian Room at the Beach House at the Fairmont Glitter Bay resort over the 2004 Memorial Day weekend and had a fabulous time.

I highly recommend the Beach House. It is beachfront and is separated from the ocean by a picturesque tree-lined retaining wall and a few rows of coral rocks. A walk down a 30 foot path puts you right on the beach where there are palm trees, umbrellas, beach chairs, and food and beverage service. To the front of the Beach House is a beautiful grassy yard and garden complete with a water lilly pond, palm trees, and stone gazebo (which is a little moss-covered and in slight disrepair, but makes for great pictures). You can park your car, if you have one, right beside the Beach House. The staff was wonderful and attentive, both at Glitter Bay and at the Royal Pavilion. Our rooms were well cleaned in the mornings and our beds were turned down in the evenings. There were plenty of towels in the room and on the beach at all times.
reviews.title: Loved Glitter Bay
Glitter Bay Problems
reviews.text: The watersports (boat ride, snorkeling, catamaran, windsurfing) were a good plus. Beach vendors approached us 2-3 times a day, but were not too pushy or too bothersome.

My wife and I stayed at glittter bay in 1984 on our honeymoon.And returned with our four children in 2004.We had a great time both times.The hotel is very quiet especialy at night so if you are looking for the bar scene this is not the place for you but if you are looking for a great smaller hotel with great food and staff I would recommend Glitter Bay
reviews.title: 2nd Time at glitter bay
Needs some TLC !
reviews.text: This hotel is in a lovely spot close to a great beach. We returned in November 2004 bacause we had really enjoyed our holiday the previous year.

reviews.title: Not so glittery Glitter Bay!
reviews.text: However, we had a fairly disasterous time, both my sons aged 9 & 11 contracted ear infections, we believe from the hotel pool, which were so bad that even after 3 trips to the local doctor they were in bed and in agony for the second half of our stay.

reviews.title: Misleading reviews over-sell this average hotel
reviews.text: The hotel staff were not really interested in our plight and claimed that the pool was tested daily and met the Barbados Government standards and that was that.

reviews.title: A Wedding in Paradise
reviews.text: I believe the hotel is due to close for refurbishment in 2005 and I would think carefully about visiting prior to its completion, after all there are plenty of other great places to stay in Barbados.

description: Glitter Bay is no longer affiliated with Fairmont Hotels.
